remarks: The composition of a function which maps the zero to zero with a finitely supported function is finitely supported.  This is not only a special case of ~ fsuppcor because it does not require that the "zero" is an element of the range of the finitely supported function. (Contributed by AV, 6-Jun-2019.)
statement:
fsuppco2.z $e |- ( ph -> Z e. W ) $.
fsuppco2.f $e |- ( ph -> F : A --> B ) $.
fsuppco2.g $e |- ( ph -> G : B --> B ) $.
fsuppco2.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. U ) $.
fsuppco2.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. V ) $.
fsuppco2.n $e |- ( ph -> F finSupp Z ) $.
fsuppco2.i $e |- ( ph -> ( G ` Z ) = Z ) $.
fsuppco2 $p |- ( ph -> ( G o. F ) finSupp Z ) $.
